article.title: A new formula for Chebotarev densities

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1: Formula for the Chebotarev densities of Frobenius elements in Galois groups.\n\nThis formula calculates the Chebotarev densities in terms of:
choices: Largest prime factors of integers n ≥ 2
Smallest prime factors of integers n ≥ 2
The sum of prime factors of integers n ≥ 2
The number of distinct prime factors of integers n ≥ 2

multiple_choice_question.text: Formula (1): Alladi\'s Result on Largest Prime Divisors\n\nThis formula by Alladi demonstrates that:
choices: Smallest prime divisors are equidistributed in arithmetic progressions modulo k
Largest prime divisors are equidistributed in arithmetic progressions modulo k
The sum of prime divisors is equidistributed in arithmetic progressions modulo k
The number of distinct prime divisors is equidistributed in arithmetic progressions modulo k

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2: Definition of μ*(n)\n\nThe function μ*(n) is defined as:
Theorem 2:  Largest Prime Divisors of Integers\n\nThis theorem provides an asymptotic formula for:
choices: The sum of smallest prime divisors of integers less than X
The count of integers less than X with largest prime divisor satisfying a certain Frobenius condition.
The sum of largest prime divisors of integers less than X
The count of integers less than X with smallest prime divisor satisfying a certain Frobenius condition.
